docs.lead_paragraph:
LABINER--Eileen Gallagher

Our adored Eileen passed away suddenly on March 16, 2015. She will be remembered for her devotion to her family and friends, generous spirit, and dedication to nutrition, the arts, and women and family issues. She is survived by Theodore; daughters, Nancy Labiner and Judy Labiner-Wolfe; sons-in-law, Robin Gray and Rob Wolfe; grandchildren, Lila Sage, Laszlo and Humphrey; and sister, Joan Meyers.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama kicked off the spring season on Saturday with a weekend golf getaway in Florida, teeing off with former NBA star Alonzo Mourning and former sportscaster Ahmad Rashad.

headline.main: Fore! Obama Golfs With Alonzo Mourning on Florida Getaway

docs.lead_paragraph: Under federal law, you sometimes have a right to use a food stamp card that was issued to someone else.

headline.main: There’s Just One Problem With Photos on Food Stamp Cards
headline.print_headline: Just One Problem With Photos on Food Stamp Cards

docs.abstract: The Upshot; Urban Institute report underlines complications of putting photos on cards used for food stamps as anti-fraud protection, since food stamps are awarded to households rather than individuals; federal laws prohibiting special scrutiny of food stamp shoppers and lack of efficacy of policy are some other reasons why few states other than Massachusetts have implemented it.
docs.snippet: Under federal law, you sometimes have a right to use a food stamp card that was issued to someone else.

docs.lead_paragraph: Charging him for desertion and misbehaving before the enemy stands to accomplish little at this point.

headline.main: No Need to Prosecute Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl
headline.print_headline: No Need to Prosecute Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl

docs.abstract: Editorial urges Army to not prosecute Sgt Bowe Bergdahl for desertion, arguing his case is extraordinary; suggests trial would raise questions about why Bergdahl was allowed into Army despite signs that he was in fragile psychological state; maintains conviction would serve little point beyond depriving traumatized veteran of benefits.
docs.snippet: Charging him for desertion and misbehaving before the enemy stands to accomplish little at this point.

headline.main: Denmark Steps Into the Skinny Model Debate

docs.abstract: Denmark’s fashion community intends to ensure there are healthy models on its runways by encouraging peer pressure within the industry.

docs.lead_paragraph: Following Warren Buffett's investment advice may be smart but nutritionists say that eating too many of the "junk-food" products made by companies he has invested in isn't quite as wise.

docs.lead_paragraph: When Indian street-food seller Kumar Pal first began treatment for multi-drug resistant tuberculosis two years ago, he quickly spiralled into depression and gave up hope of living.

headline.main: Jemima Kirke’s Workout Thwarts the Usual Fitness Trends

docs.abstract: The “Girls” actor let T into a personal training session at Brooklyn Strength, where she engages in a mix of Pilates and Kettlebell work to get strong — not skinny.

docs.lead_paragraph: House and Senate Republicans steamed ahead Tuesday toward likely approval of balanced budget outlines, essential early steps along a path to send President Barack Obama legislation to wipe out his five-year-old health care law and eliminate deficits within a decade.
